trans-unit.resname: J17·1 | Avacyn, Angel of Hope | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Avacyn, Angel of Hope
trans-unit.target: Avacyn, Angel of Hope

trans-unit.resname: J17·1 | Avacyn, Angel of Hope | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: Flying, vigilance, indestructible
trans-unit.target: Flying, vigilance, indestructible

trans-unit.resname: J17·1 | Avacyn, Angel of Hope | Card Text | Paragraph 2
trans-unit.source: Other permanents you control have indestructible.
trans-unit.target: Other permanents you control have indestructible.

trans-unit.resname: J17·1 | Avacyn, Angel of Hope | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: A golden helix streaked skyward from the Helvault. A thunderous explosion shattered the silver monolith and Avacyn emerged, free from her prison at last.
trans-unit.target: A golden helix streaked skyward from the Helvault. A thunderous explosion shattered the silver monolith and Avacyn emerged, free from her prison at last.

trans-unit.resname: J17·2 | Capture of Jingzhou | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Capture of Jingzhou
trans-unit.target: Capture of Jingzhou

trans-unit.resname: J17·2 | Capture of Jingzhou | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: Take an extra turn after this one.
trans-unit.target: Take an extra turn after this one.

trans-unit.resname: J17·2 | Capture of Jingzhou | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.
trans-unit.target: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

trans-unit.resname: J17·3 | Gaddock Teeg | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Gaddock Teeg
trans-unit.target: Gaddock Teeg

trans-unit.resname: J17·3 | Gaddock Teeg | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: Noncreature spells with mana value 4 or greater can't be cast.
trans-unit.target: Noncreature spells with mana value 4 or greater can't be cast.

trans-unit.resname: J17·3 | Gaddock Teeg | Card Text | Paragraph 2
trans-unit.source: Noncreature spells with {X} in their mana costs can't be cast.
trans-unit.target: Noncreature spells with {X} in their mana costs can't be cast.

trans-unit.resname: J17·3 | Gaddock Teeg | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: So great is his wisdom and spirit that many who have met him say that they stood before a giant of a man and talked to the wisest of the four winds.
trans-unit.target: So great is his wisdom and spirit that many who have met him say that they stood before a giant of a man and talked to the wisest of the four winds.

trans-unit.target: Homeward Path

trans-unit.target: {T}: Add {C}.

trans-unit.resname: J17·4 | Homeward Path | Card Text | Paragraph 2

trans-unit.target: {T}: Each player gains control of all creatures they own.

trans-unit.resname: J17·4 | Homeward Path | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "Let your heels point you home."\n—Ancient blessing
trans-unit.target: "Let your heels point you home."\n—Ancient blessing

trans-unit.resname: J17·5 | Doran, the Siege Tower | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Doran, the Siege Tower
trans-unit.target: Doran, the Siege Tower

trans-unit.resname: J17·5 | Doran, the Siege Tower | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: Each creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.
trans-unit.target: Each creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.

trans-unit.resname: J17·5 | Doran, the Siege Tower | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "Each year that passes rings you inwardly with memory and might. Wield your heart, and the world will tremble."
trans-unit.target: "Each year that passes rings you inwardly with memory and might. Wield your heart, and the world will tremble."

trans-unit.target: Prismatic Geoscope

trans-unit.source: CARDNAME enters the battlefield tapped.
trans-unit.target: CARDNAME enters the battlefield tapped.

trans-unit.resname: J17·6 | Prismatic Geoscope | Card Text | Paragraph 2
trans-unit.source: Domain — {T}: Add X mana in any combination of colors, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
trans-unit.target: Domain — {T}: Add X mana in any combination of colors, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

trans-unit.target: {U/P}: Change a target of target spell or ability to CARDNAME. ({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)

trans-unit.resname: J17·7 | Spellskite | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "Let's show Vorinclex that progress doesn't always need teeth or claws."\n—Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

trans-unit.resname: J17·8 | Pendelhaven | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: The limbs of Pendelhaven extend as far as the meek roam, and reach as high as they strive.
trans-unit.target: The limbs of Pendelhaven extend as far as the meek roam, and reach as high as they strive.

trans-unit.resname: J17·9 | Rules Lawyer | Card Name
trans-unit.source: Rules Lawyer
trans-unit.target: Rules Lawyer

trans-unit.resname: J17·9 | Rules Lawyer | Card Text | Paragraph 1
trans-unit.source: State-based actions don't apply to you or other permanents you control. (You don't lose the game due to having 0 or less life or drawing from an empty library. Your creatures aren't destroyed due to damage or deathtouch and aren't put into a graveyard due to having 0 or less toughness. Your planeswalkers aren't put into a graveyard if they have 0 loyalty. You don't put a legendary permanent into a graveyard if you control two with the same name. Counters aren't removed from your permanents due to game rules. Permanents you control attached or combined illegally remain on the battlefield. For complete rules and regulations, see rule 704.)
trans-unit.target: State-based actions don't apply to you or other permanents you control. (You don't lose the game due to having 0 or less life or drawing from an empty library. Your creatures aren't destroyed due to damage or deathtouch and aren't put into a graveyard due to having 0 or less toughness. Your planeswalkers aren't put into a graveyard if they have 0 loyalty. You don't put a legendary permanent into a graveyard if you control two with the same name. Counters aren't removed from your permanents due to game rules. Permanents you control attached or combined illegally remain on the battlefield. For complete rules and regulations, see rule 704.)
